alert.note: Alert for Bleckley; Pulaski (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 30 at 3:41AM EDT until further notice by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Flint River at GA 26 near Montezuma affecting Macon, Dooly and Sumter Counties. Flint River at US 19 near Carsonville affecting Upson, Crawford, Talbot and Taylor Counties. Ocmulgee River at US 341 at Hawkinsville affecting Bleckley and Pulaski Counties. Ocmulgee River near Macon affecting Houston, Jones, Monroe, Bibb and Twiggs Counties. Oconee River at Dublin affecting Washington, Laurens, Wilkinson and Johnson Counties. Oconee River near Oconee affecting Washington, Wilkinson and Johnson Counties. For the Flint River Basin...including Lovejoy, Peachtree City, Fayetteville, Americus, Peachtree City, Woolsey, Sharpsburg, Peachtree City, Peachtree City, Senoia, Griffin, Griffin, Orchard Hill, Molena, Thomaston, Carsonville, Montezuma, Byromville...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Ocmulgee River Basin...including Jackson, Griffin, Juliette, Juliette, Dames Ferry, Macon, Macon, Hawkinsville, Byron, Clinchfield, Hawkinsville, Abbeville, McRae, Scotland, Lumber City... Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Oconee River Basin...including Penfield, Milledgeville, Oconee, Oconee, McIntyre, Irwinton, Oconee, Dublin, Mount Vernon... Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Ocmulgee River at US 341 at Hawkinsville. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 26 feet, Moderate flooding begins...with several homes surrounded by flood waters and at least 3 homes begin flooding near Gooseneck Lane and RiverView Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:45 AM EDT Thursday the stage was 22.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:45 AM EDT Thursday was 22.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 26.9 feet early tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 20 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 26.9 feet on 03/09/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
